dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A highrise in downtown L.A., framed tall against the mountains. People stream out of the front door, leaving work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the near darkness of basement, a security guard makes his way into an inner cellar. His flashlight finds a man in work clothes bent over a panel, his back to the light.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey. This area's restricted. The man doesn't look around. We can just almost see his face as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, |, uh, got calledin... some of this wiring got screwed up.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND
dialogues.text: reaches into his toolbox. He rises, turning, and A KNIFE |S SHOVED THROUGH HIS EAR. It is pulled back out with calmefficiency. The man turns, wide-eyed, hand to his ear. Mouth open in silent protest. Out of his hand drops the work order. He slumps over. Dies. HOWARD FISK takes off the guard's hat. Dripping knife aside, he is an ordinary-looking man. His face is dead calm, only his eyes betraying the sea of hate behind it. He drags the body into a dark corner, grabbing a duffle b from out of the shadows. Then checking his watch, he goes to the panel and begins making adjustments of his own. WE PAN over to the door of the panel. It reads: ELEVATORS.

dialogues.text: A car comes SCREECHING to a halt near the front of the building, a red and blue light flashing on top. The door is thrown open and SWAT officer JACK TRAVEN steps out fro behind the wheel almost before the car has stopped. Jack heads straight for the entrance as HARRY TEMPLE, his olde partner gets out the other side and follows, tossing Jack his flak jacket. Jack puts it on without ever taking his eyes off the entrance as they make their way through poli cars, fire trucks and various uniforms. WE SEE these two are a team, and that when they move, Jack takes the lead. We are still TRACKING with Jack and Harry as WE SEE two more SWAT guys emerge from another car, fall into step. Then McMahon hangs up the phone, addresses the group.

dialogues.text: Fisk has a radio set-up, is listening in on the various police exchanges. He suddenly hears sounds of Harry and Jack echoing down the elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Pop quiz, hot shot. Psycho rigs an elevator to drop thirty stories...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: .What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: JACK

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

dialogues.text: The woman, terrified, looks down at her legs. The elevato just clipped off her high heel. Jack and Harry exchange a look. The other SWAT guys usher the rescued passengers to the stairwell as Jack and Harry lean against the wall, a litt out of breath.

dialogues.text: Is your watch sl ow?

The car sinks slightly fromtheir weight Jack points at the hatch cover on the elevator roof. Harr nods and pulls his Glock. He and Jack kneel by the hatch cover. Jack grabs the handle. Harry makes the countdown hand signals. Three, two - A shotgun BLAST nearly takes their heads off, splintering part of the hatch cover. Both men jump back. A second shot right by Harry's foot sends him jumping away, he ste on the hatch cover and it gives away. He falls into the elevator, hitting his head badly.

The elevator barrels toward the ceiling of the shaft. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.text: Jack comes crashing down into the elevator, lands hard. The air is thick with shotgun smoke. The few lights not shot out flicker. Jack looks up and is transfixed. He's looking into...

dialogues.speaker: THE BARREL OF A SHOTGUN
dialogues.text: He hears a voice out of the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: | don't suppose anybody would pay three million just for you. Fisk chuckles. Then a loud, dull click. Another click. The shotgun is empty.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Brings his gun up fast.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Drop it! The gun drops. Through smoke and flickering light, Jack gets a good |ook at Howard Fisk. Fisk is calm, his arm around the still groggy Harry. In his hand is a deadman's stick. His coat opens enough for us to see he has sticks of dynamite roped around his chest.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Pop quiz, hotshot. Terrorist holding a police hostage. He's got enough dynamite strapped to his chest to blow the building in half. What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMahon screams into his walkie talkie. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.text: | want location on those goddamn shots! Briggs! Where is Jack and Harry?

dialogues.text: Jack keeps steady aim at Fisk.

dialogues.speaker: JACK

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: Well, end of the line. This day has been a real disappointment, | don't mind saying. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.text: Why, ‘cause you didn't get to kill everyone? True hatred flashes in Fisk's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: There'll come a time, boy, you'll wish you never met me.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm pretty much there already. Fisk starts to back up, dragging Harry with him.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: See, |'min charge here! | drop this stick, they pick up your friend with a sponge.

dialogues.text: (to Harry) Are you ready to die, friend?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: (warily) In two hundred years we've gone from'! regret that | have but one life to give for my country’ to "fuck you.'

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Drop the stick!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Harry) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Man, we got all the balls in the world right here! ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Give it up! Fisk drags Harry out. Jack doesn't know what to do. Harry looks at Jack. He barely mouthes the words.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shoot the hostage. Jack can't move. Fisk and Harry head toward swinging door that lead to the garage. Jack watches, gun trained on Fis

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do it. He shifts aim and BLASTS Harry in the leg. Harry goes dow and Fisk can't take him anywhere. Almost I aughing with disbelief, Fisk lets go, starts running. Jack starts shooting through the pipes and crates. One of the shots grazes Fisk in the neck, spins him back to face Jack. Even then, Fisk has this strange grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: STUMBLES through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Runs after him, reloading as he does...

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS
dialogues.text: ... Swing back and forth. They slow. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE EXPLOSI ON
dialogues.text: Blasts out fromthe garage. Rips the doors from their hinges. Lights go out. Plaster and cement flies.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is knocked fifteen feet back into the far wall. He lies still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator hostages and cops in attendance. Jack and Harry stand to one side of the podiumin full dress unifor as the Mayor gives a droning speech. Harry has a cane.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: ...the dedication and bravery that make L.A.'s finest truly her finest. Fifteen citizens owe their lives to this team, and particularly the two officers we are here to honor... Thanks to them, the only life taken by a terrorist's bomb was his own...

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND HARRY
