dialogues.text: Everyone, |'m Jack Traven, L.A.P.D. We got a : ight...situation on the bus re... Annie rises from her seat

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: What's going on? Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ma'am, if you'll please sit down, we can deal with this in an orderly --

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: But what are you --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ma‘ am His tone is so stern she sits right down. Jack makes his way down the bus, looking at everyone In the back, Ray starts sweating as Jack approaches. His hands reach for something under his coat

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: ...1f everyone will just stay in your seats and remain calm and quiet, then we'll be able to defuse the...problem So, sit tight. Ray suddenly leaps out of his seat

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Get away from me! He levels a gun at Jack. Instinctively Jack whips his own out, and the two are at close range stand-off. Ray | ooks more scared than anything. There are a few screams. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | don't know you, man. I'm not here for you. Let's not do this.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Stop the bus!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He can't.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Shut up! He moves forward. Jack backs up, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (to Ray) Stay cool, man.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (to Sam) Stop the bus! Sam looks around, unsure what to do

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Look. I'm putting my gun away. (he does, slowly) Okay? Okay? Listen. | don' care about your crime. Whatever you did, I'm sure...that you're sorry, and so it's cool now. It's over. (he drops his badge on the ground) And I'm not a cop right now. See? We're just two cool guys. Just hanging on the bus. Despite the fumbling manner of Jack's speech, his tone do have a hypnotic lull. Ray looks like he might | ower the gun. Ortiz jumps him

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He rushes forward as Ortiz and Ray struggle. A SHOT goes off, everyone ducking and screaming. A second shot. The driver's partition SHATTERS. Samlurches to one side, hit in the back.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Sam! |! The bus swerves sickeningly as Sam slumps over. Annie dives for the wheel, Helen to help Sam. Jack moves in and with two crunching blows disarms and subdues Ray. Simultaneously:

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (to Hel en) Move hi m!

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He's bleeding!

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: I've got to stop this thing! Jack spins around.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: NO! Stay above fifty!

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: We've got a wounded --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You slow down and this bus'l| expl ode! Silence. Annie looks briefly back at Jack, sees he's not kidding. She looks back at the speedometer, which is almost under 51. Pushes her foot on the accelerator. Jack addresses everyone as he handcuffs Ray to a pole.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There is a bomb on this bus. If we slow down, it'll blow. (more) ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JACK (cont'd) (clicks on one cuff) If anyone tries to get off, it'l bl ow (clicks on the other) Wide eyes, some quiet tears. Terry stands up.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Oh, this is bullshit! Nobody's gonna -- This is some joke

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (in his face) Are we gonna have a problem now? A moment. Terry backs down.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He's bleeding bad! | don't know what to do. There's all this blood... Mrs. Kamino pulls off her sweater, going over and wrappin it around Sam's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: only gonna make it through f everyone stays calm and own. (to Ortiz) That means you, Gigantor We'r his its e i q ao Terry moves to help lay Sam out more comfortably. Jack goes over to Annie. She is staring straight ahead, death grip on the wheel: she's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: This is great. A bomb on wheels.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ma'am, can you handle this bus?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Sure. Sure, | can do this. It's just like driving a really big Pinto. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (not amused) Can you handle it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (bridles) I'mfine. What's the plan, is there a plan?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (taking the cellular from his back pocket) Just for you to drive. We're okay for now. Just stay above fifty. She takes a breath. Calms herself. He dials.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You're a cop, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Then | should probably tell you: I'mjust taking the bus ‘cause | had my driver's license revoked.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Speeding. He allows himself a grin as he dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norwood and McMahon board a police chopper. It lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus races along. High above it we see the local news helicopters, cameras trained on it.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four TVs are on, playing all the different newscasts. Fisk sits, watching the various helicopter shots of the b We focus in on channel 7, the newscaster's voice rising fromthe general cacophony.

dialogues.speaker: CHANNEL 7 ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Apparently a_member of the L.A.P.D. SWAT team boarded the bus just minutes ago...

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Would that be you, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry at his desk. Robin and SWAT Cop #1.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay...Check the speedometer. Has it been fucked with, loosened...any wires? Jack checks.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, it's clean.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then it's gonna be under the bus. Probably rigged to one of the axles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | can't get under the bus right now, Harry. It's kind of in motion. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: Sam makes a grunting sound in Jack's direction.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Officer? Hey, Officer Traven. She beckons to Jack, who kneels by Sam.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There's...access panel...in the floor. He points to the center of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hold on. He goes over and unscrews the panel, pulls it aside. Pavement rushes beneath him. He hands the phone to Stephens.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hold on to this, please. Tell him what | see. Stephens takes the phone nervously as Jack sticks his hea down through the hole. It is dark and cramped down there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay, there's a wad right here, pretty big...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (into phone) There's a pretty big wad...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Brass fittings... | think | can reach the circuit wire.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: He can reach the circuit wire.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't. That'll be a decoy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What else? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hold on... Jack .V., the Ww. It's hard to see very far with tanks and pipes. lowers his head even further down. From his P. undercarriage closer to the front comes into vi

e Fuck me... There is an obscene mass of plastique stuck to the front. Detonators, wires, a jerry-rigged timer built around a gutted gold wristwatch. A lot of the gold plating has flaked off, dull grey beneath.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (transl ating) Oh darn... Jack pulls himself out of the hole, grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Harry, there's enough C4 on this thing to put a hole in the world.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (worried) All right, be calmlike me. What else?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Three triggers. One on the axle | can't really see. Cellular remote and a timer, running off a wristwatch. Something about that bothers Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What kind of watch?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Too far to see. Gold band, fairly cheesy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Officer... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Traven, NOW Jack races to the front, looks out the window with Annie THEIR P.O. V. Ahead, a domino tide of red brake lights washes back.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Get on the shoulder Annie nods, veers onto the right shoulder, blasting past the slowing traffic. But then they see..

dialogues.speaker: THEIR P.O. V
dialogues.text: A half-mile ahead, there's a STALLED CAR being rolled ont the back of a TOW TRUCK on the shoulder. Behind it, there's an OFF- RAMP

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Get off or stay on?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (thinks) Shit. Annie tries to squeeze the bus between the tow truck and the slow lane. he hits the car on back, sends it FLYING over the front of the truck. She keeps going, sideswiping several cars.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Jack... What now?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Off. OFF! Annie steers off the freeway at the last second, onto the exit ramp.  54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roars down the off-ramp, slamming into the water barrels. Far ahead, cars are stopped at the light. The ramp is a single lane. The bus jumps the curb, taking out roadway signs, reflectors and car mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the next few minutes, whenever she doesn't need to us both hands to drive, her hand is on the horn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Everybody hold on! Annie's hands and feet are in constant motion. The passengers are knocked about, yelling. Jack and Annie's faces -- uh-oh. They see...

dialogues.speaker: A RED LIGHT
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the ramp. Cross traffic. ANNI E' § FOOT Hesitates over the brake, then...

dialogues.speaker: JACK' S
dialogues.text: Stomps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Rockets through the intersection. Cars fishtail, nearly colliding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam winces. Helen holds his hand. Jack and Annie stare at...

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: It dips close to 50, rises... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Share a look of relief, look ahead. The street is clear for a half-mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbeknownst to them, a WOMAN, 30s, pushes a BABY CARRI AG along the sidewalk. She is talking to another woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment's respite. The cellular rings.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah...Mac, where've you been? We had to bail on the freeway, we're in the city!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMahon is looking out the window. He has a map of the city on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: | can see you, Jack. ANGLE ON MCMAHON'S P.O. V. The bus charges through the maze of streets.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Keep going straight. We're trying to clear the roads for you. We'll get you out, Jack. He consults the map closely, trying to pinpoint the bus's location.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Barrels down the streets.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fisk watches, eating a baloney sandwich on white bread and a glass of milk. We SEE that three of the TV's have the bus on them, but the fourth one is turned to a footba game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks at the things on his desk; evidence from Fisk last job, lined up and tagged. Robin is standing nearby with SWAT Cop #1.

dialogues.speaker: ROBI N
dialogues.text: | don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A watch is a shitty timer. Why use it? What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Lots of people have watches, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: This guy has no MO. Bombers fall in love with one kind of bomb and they're very monogamous. This guy uses C4, dynamite, different trigger every time, now he throws in this watch.

dialogues.speaker: ROBI N
dialogues.text: He's an encyclopedia. Knows every kind of bomb.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (slow realization) And everything we do to dismantle them. Robin, | want to look at files fromthe last, say, ten years.

dialogues.speaker: ROBI N
dialogues.text: We did the mug shots, Harry --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. | wanna look at cops.  57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars cruising to an intersection are overtaken by a screaming black & white. It reaches the intersection and turns, screeching, halting in front of traffic and blocki the intersection. The cars slamon their brakes, nearly hitting the patrol car. The passengers barely have time to curse before the enormous bus ROARS by, going the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passengers watch the city streets fly by, panic volum turned high.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: SEES a GARBAGE TRUCK back out in front of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Pulls the wheel hard left.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Swerves into oncoming traffic. The bus dodges oncoming cars, trucks and other buses, bumping a few. A Lincoln peels off the side of the bus, goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women wave goodbye. Woman #1 pushes the baby carriage toward the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac still looks at his map.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: You got about...ten more blocks and there'll be some units waiting. Follow them straight, then there's a left at the T. You'll head onto the 105 freeway. It's not in use yet; it'll be empty.  58

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ri ght.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues on.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN AND THE BABY CARRI AGE
dialogues.text: Steps out from behind a van right in front of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE AND JACK
dialogues.text: Horror. It's too late. Annie shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HE BUS
dialogues.text: Smashes into the baby carriage as the woman pushing it jumps clear.

dialogues.speaker: ACK AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Her eyes are shut. She screams. Jack can't help but | ook ACK'S P.O. V. SLOW MOTION. The baby carriage is knocked seventy feet in front and to the side of the bus, sailing through the air

dialogues.speaker: ACK
dialogues.text: His eyes following. He grimaces as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hits the pavement. But then... a hundred empty soda and beer cans explode out of it.

dialogues.speaker: NT. THE BUS
dialogues.text: Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There's your baby. Annie opens her eyes, !ooks in the sideview mirror. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: HER P.O. V.
dialogues.text: The woman is running after the bus, shaking her fist, stopping to pick up the cans. Annie sighs with relief.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Looks just like you, honey. THEIR P.O. V. Here at last are the patrol cars, which start up, leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches the streets. After a few blocks...

dialogues.speaker: THE PATROL CARS
dialogues.text: Come to the on-ramp. The bus follows when...

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF SCHOOL KI DS
dialogues.text: Walk blithely in front of it -- Annie is forced to SWERVE and continue on the street parallel to the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (panicked and pissed) Why aren't they in school?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mac, we're boned!

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: | saw. Keep straight. He consults the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrol cars pull in front of it again, leading it.  60

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Jack, there's another entrance in about two miles. You've gotta make an ugly turn, though.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How ugly?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (worried) What's ugly? Jack listens a moment more on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Annie) We got a hard right coming up. At the construction site. Annie looks out the window. The construction site is far away but visible. Annie can't even see the road to turn o

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: This is a dead end

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (staring out, not convinced) There's a turn... There is a turn. Way ahead, the first patrol car takes it -- and nearly wipes out. Another follows, with al attendant screeching.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: | can't make that

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Keep left.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: But it's --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Keep left! You take it wide!

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: We're gonna tip over! ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Everyone on this side of the bus! The passengers hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Now! The passengers all scramble, squeeze in by each other. They look at each other, scared. Ray strains to get over, cuffed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Move! Move! As far over as you can! Hurry! Annie eases the accelerator off as far as it is safe. The turn is fifty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (quietly, into the phone) Mac, you better clear the site. He turns back to Annie. Annie arcs out to flatten the turn as much as possible.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hold on! She turns the wheel and dives into the turn. The passengers are thrown. Most hold on. The bus tires screech on the pavement. One wheel lifts of the ground for a second. Some passengers scream, most hold their breath. Annie strains against the steering wheel to hold it stead She's losing it. Jack grabs the wheel and pulls it with her, holding the turn. The bus wheel comes back down onto the pavement. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Annie and Jack bring the bus back into line. They made it Jack turns back to the passengers, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the passengers untangle themselves, Helen looks white a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good lord, we might have...I can't think...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (helping her sit) It's okay. If you need to, you go right ahead and vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches the on-ramp, shoots up through the saw-horses and they're on.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Touches down nearby. Mac gets out, talking to Norwood as he tries to fold the map.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: | want choppers up ahead, make sure there's nothing obstructing the freeway. We got a window here; let's keep it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of respite.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ma'am, you did very well. He looks at her. Drops the hostage talk, smiles. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Actually, you were incredible. I've never seen driving like that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Annie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: ...iS my name. Annie. As opposed to ma'am. They smile at each other for a moment. Annie looks back a the road.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Why is all this happening? Did we bomb this guy's country or something?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's just a guy that wants money. Annie looks at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No... | don't buy it. This is not a good way to make money. Odds are, we should be dead already. What's this guy's deal?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (after a beat) A while back this guy held some people for ransom. It went sour, and now he's a little pissed at me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Then what does this -- ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's a game. If he gets the money, he wins. If the bus blows up, he wins.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: So what happens if you win?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then tomorrow we'll play another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Robin lean over a computer worked by SWAT Cop #1. On the screen, a series of faces flash by. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP
dialogues.text: We got no match for that description. No one's lost a thumb, at least for the last ten years.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: He could be from anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP
dialogues.text: | can't access all that

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Forget the files. (to Robin) | want you to go through the pension fund. This guys drawing disability. He may not be L.A.P.D. But he's living here now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (calls out) | want pictures! (to himself) I've seen this asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMahon pulls up next to it on the back of a flat bed. Jack comes out on the steps to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Let's start unloading the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Can't do it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: No time for stunts, Traven. We get those people out of harm's way --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | got orders. (indicates news choppers) We move these people, he'll see. Crazy not stupid, remember? Mac accepts it, scowling.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Harry's working on finding this guy. We think he may be a police. Norwood leans out of the cab of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: It's him. He wants to talk to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Give him the number. He steps into the bus, look at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: The bleeding is less, but... Her look tells him Sam doesn't have much time. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Are they going to help us?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: Sure they are. They're the police. Hey, your taxes are paying their salary. If we die they gotta take a pay cut! Helen bl anches.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: | mean... The phone rings. Jack puts it to his ear

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Jack, | think we have trust, but it looks on the TV like you're trying to get those passengers off the bus.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You gotta let me have one

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Now, we went over the rules...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come on, as an act of faith. We got an injured man here. The driver's been shot

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Jack! Tell me you haven't been shooting the passengers. thought it was customary for a police officer to shoot the bad men? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang 67 (2)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, get in range.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: No one gets off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come on! This guy has no time. It'll grease the wheels with the money men if you show a little charity. There's still gonna be plenty of us to kill.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Okay, son. You can try unload the driver. Tell the wildcat behind the wheel not to slow down, though, or he won't get the chance to bleed to death. And Jack..

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Don't slip. up. Jack crosses to the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're gonna get the driver off.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Just him?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: For now. (to Ortiz) Gi gant or.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: (standing) Ortiz.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ortiz, I'm gonna need your help ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (no one is listening) What about the rest of us?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: You have to keep him straight or | think the wound will tear.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) McMahon, he's letting us unload the driver. Pull up alongside us. He bends over to grab Sam's feet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Sam) How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Like |'ve been shot. Jack lifts, so does Ortiz at the head. Sam groans with pain and Ray rushes in to support his middle. He and Orti exchange a look. They walk himto the doorway. McMahon's truck is right next to them. Jack stands on the bottom step, yells to the SWAT guy on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We gotta keep him straight! gh t The SWAT guy nods. Jack inches out farther. He holds Sam's legs with one hand and the railing with the other, leaning out toward the truck. The pavement rushes by underneath him. The SWAT guy grab Sam and slowly, the exchange is made. Jack steps back into the bus, where Mrs. Kamino is wiping up bl ood.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | think he's gonna be -- ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Wai t ! Helen suddenly leaps out of her seat and rushes to the door. Her face is etched in panic. She comes to the last step, hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No! He rushes to the front. Helen stands. The SWAT guy waves for her to jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk sees this on TV. He punches a button on his cellular

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: The small bomb directly below Helen. Red light comes on.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT STEPS
dialogues.text: Explode. SWAT guys are knocked off their feet, Jack is knocked into Annie and the bus swerves. Helen falls. Jack grabs at her too late, the bus bumps sickeningly, as Jack almost falls, grabbed by the lady in Catwoman's glasses. For a moment, nothing. Jack sits back on the floor of the bus at Annie's feet, staring at the hole that was steps. Annie is nearly hyperventilating, her eyes locked on the road.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Watches on the TV. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Interactive TV, Jack. Wave of the future.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: More silence. ( CONT! NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Completely shocked. This guy ain't fuckin’ around. A woman starts crying, quietly. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into the walkie talkie) McMahon, get those fucking choppers off my ass! Ortiz takes his jacket off, puts it around Mrs. Kamino's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: Thanks you. I'ma little cold.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (quietly and politely hysterical) Jesus. | can't be here. | can't -- this bus is -- this is the wrong bus... for me to... | can't die here.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Hey, shut up, man! | got a wife!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (in his own world) You do?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (curious, but with a little attitude) So if you have a wife and | don't, does that mean that |'m expendable?

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The guy's just talkin’ crazy, gets on my nerves! ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And then all at once:

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: | think | have the right to be a little upset after all we've --

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: (to Ortiz) What are you staring at everybody for, poking your nose in, let us die in peace, you --

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Let's stop all this bullshit, we're just making more trouble --

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (to Ortiz) I'minterested to see how long before the mighty caveman comes to the surface and starts throwing rocks at people's heads -- As the din rises:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, can that shit! Jesus, it's like a school bus! He looks at Annie. She is shaking with the effort not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (kneeling by her) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you need? She takes a moment. Jack brushes hair from her face

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: When that bomb went off... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | know. She shakes her head

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: When it blew, | thought that was it, | thought that was the bomb and | was dead, and... when | saw her fall under the bus, | was... This is not an easy thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You were glad you were still alive

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (it's true) Oh God, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't be. You should be glad. We all are. That doesn't mean you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don't care. It means you're a human being.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: She looked so scared...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She was scared. She was a nice lady who didn't deserve to get killed. But Annie, if she'd gotten off he would have killed us all. He's the asshole, Annie, the guy who put us here. Remember that. Okay? She nods, shakily.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) Do they teach you how to talk nice to hysterical hostages in cop school ? ( CONT! NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No, it's mostly tying square knots and how to build fires, stuff like that. She smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We should be okay for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening on a headset, Norwood's face goes dazzling whit

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Are you sure? How far? (to McMahon) Sir, we have a serious problem.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: This freeway isn't finished.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: The choppers caught is about three miles ahead. There's a section missing.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: But... It's on the map! It's finished on the goddamn map!

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: | guess they fell behind.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Fuck! You're fired, everybody's fucking fired. How big a section?

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: Fifty feet, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: (to Norwood) Get me closer. He gestures for Jack to come to the door. The flatbed truck...

dialogues.speaker: VEERS
dialogues.text: ...right next to the bus.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Jack, there's a gap in the road. It's big.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Fifty feet, it's in the interchange, somewhere after the next turn.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: We gotta get them off someway.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There's a gap in the road. Couple of miles up. Various reactions. Groans, fear, tears. People look at each other, realizing these are the last faces they're going to see. No one knows what to say, except maybe Orti

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: You can always count on the cops, man... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh no... well uh, shift to neutral engine revving high?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He'd've thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, what, then? , what if I, and keep the They're waiting for his answer, which he doesn't have. He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Floor it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yes! It's an overpass, there might be an incline. Floor it! She nods. The bus starts picking up speed. The speedometer climbs above sixty. Jack starts toward the back of the bus. The passengers ar silent, terrified. He looks at their faces as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | want everybody to hold onto the seat in front of them, or whatever's nearest. Heads down. (to the lady with presents) Put that stuff under your seat.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (scared) Is this really gonna work? Jack looks at hima second. What do you say? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Definitely. He comes to Ray, unlocks his cuffs. Ray looks pretty smal

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: | didn't mean to shoot that guy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (not unkindly) Keep hold of the seat in front of you. Which means, for now, apology accepted. Jack moves back t the front. Jack looks out the window -- the signs and barriers are approaching.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Everybody hold on! People grab rails, cling to them, heads in their laps. Ortiz takes a cross fromunder his shirt, palms it.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Watches fromthe truck, stopped on the empty freeway, alon with the other SWAT cops. Some mumble prayers...

dialogues.speaker: THE GAP IN THE FREEWAY
dialogues.text: The bus is coming in fast, getting faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry is sitting by Ray.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: | never shot nobody before...Jesus | hope that guy doesn't die... Terry looks like he's going to throw up. Mrs. Kamino is quietly crying. We hear various mumbled prayers. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONT
dialogues.text: Stephens is in a near fetal position, clutching his map like a religious icon. ANNIE'S P.O. V. They screaming at the gap.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yells, shuts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Pushes Annie down, covers her body with his, and puts his hands over hers on the steering wheel trying to hold the bus straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hits the gap going 73. It's airborne. The front end starts to dive. The font wheels hit the concrete edge of the far side of the gap hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, Annie, the passengers -- all thrown forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tires don't burst. The wheels roll up onto the freewa surface, keep moving. The tail end of the bus is still in mid-air, dropping fast. The undercarriage hits the concrete, scrapes, sheets of sparks and horrible grinding

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: 60, 59, 58... dropping fast.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: The rear wheels hit the edge of the gap very hard. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Passengers near the back are tossed into the air. Windows shatter. A seat is ripped fromits mooring.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Keeps on rolling.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON AND THE SWAT COPS
dialogues.text: All cheering, whooping it up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Annie) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I'mokay. I'mall right. Jack stands, addresses the passengers.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Is everybody okay? They're bruised, dazed, bleeding -- but whole. A muted chorus of "yeahs", followed by some boisterous whoops and even applause. People |augh, hug, high five. People who were crying are now laughing and crying. Terry kisses Mrs Kamino (but only if they're sitting by each other).

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: You're the man, Annie, you are the man.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (beami ng) We are way out of control.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Goddamn! Yes! He high fives (or some such display) the person next to h Only Stephens hasn't moved, still in his fetal position. He slowly opens his eyes. Smiles wanly as he looks around hi m. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: | felt we would make it. Jack smiles, big. He looks at Annie. A trickle of blood is running from her forehead. He kneels by her, beaming a her with honest admiration.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | think you missed your calling... (dabbing at the blood with his sleeve) You should have been a pilot. She smiles, too. Jack sees something ahead. Gets an idea. He has to act fast.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Get off! Now! Get off this --

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: What ? She hesitates a second too long for his liking, so he gra the wheel, pulls it hard right. Passengers yell as they are tossed to the side.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Swerves over sharply onto an exit ramp.

dialogues.speaker: FREEWAY GAP
dialogues.text: McMahon gets into the SWAT police van with Norwood.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: (to Norwood) Where the hell's he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads "LAX cargo entrance." Annie drives the bus toward the airport gate. The helicopters veer off, away fromthe air traffic. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Head there. She is, but a patrol car appears, partially blocking the entrance she's headed for. She swerves to miss it, heads toward an exit with tire shredding spikes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Turns hard. Passengers are thrown off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Swerves back for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OUTSIDE REAR TI RE
dialogues.text: Nicks the last of the spikes, but doesn't burst.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Never a dull moment. (to herself) Please God, send me a dull moment... EXT. Al RPORT The bus turns onto a taxiway adjacent to a runway as a 74 thunders overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the freeway. coP He's at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: The airport? There's thousands of people --

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: That's my boy, Jack. He should be able to circle around the runways. Buy us some time.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: We can't fly in there. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Neither can the news boys. (to the driver) Let's move! Back to the exit! The GMC Suburban pulls out. Norwood points out the airpor on the map. Mac looks.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: Tell himto head here. There's a road there circles the freight terminals. Should be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Let's hope they built it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephens looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: (unhappy) We're at the airport.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: I've already seen the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. Al RPORT Mac's van follows where the bus went.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: Hovering near the airport, they give up and fly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Jack picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hello. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: GMC SUBURBAN
dialogues.text: Enters airport through the same gate as the bus. Flies by the gate guard who points out the direction the bus went

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: Very exciting, Jack. Some close calls, but you've done all right for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Money, Jack. | wish | had some loftier purpose, but in the end I'mjust like you and me. I'd like large nonsequential bills in two clear plastic bags. Unmarked Can you remember all that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are you telling me for?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: want you to help me get it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: before it gets too late. | don' like negotiators, Jack. They talk to you like they're your best friend, and they don't know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they mess with me, do they think I'm doing this for fun?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Oh, that's not fair, Jack. You don't know how | feel about this. You don't know about me

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: (after a moment) They don't think that. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (voice raised) Do you want this money? Come on, show me your commitment. Let me get on the ground (a beat) Just me. That's not against the rules.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: All right. I'd like you back in ten minutes or less.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: Jack, nothing tricky, now. You know |'mon the top of you. Do not attempt to grow a brain. Jack hangs up. Annie has heard the bulk of the conversation. A GMC Suburban pulls up next to the bus, McMahon, Norwood and SWAT Driver ride alongside

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: There's a plan now, right?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Could be (to the group) Everybody sit tight. I'm getting off for a minute. Some conversation.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: (over him) Do you think that's a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: Are you just gonna leave us here? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: (reasonably) | would.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Don't worry... | won't go far (to Annie) Just keep circling. You'll be fine. Annie looks at him. She knows she may not see him again, but she's gonna be brave

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (a little weakly) Don't forget about us, okay? They look at each other for a moment. Jack tenderly brushes her hair from her face. He's never gonna forget her. Jack turns to the doorway. He motions for the truck to come in close. He jumps. For a moment everyone is silent on the bus. The host has left the party.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND MCMAHON
dialogues.text: talk as the GMC Suburban veers off the road and the bus charges off in the distance behind them. They pass a news van, cops keeping the news people from filming.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: The choppers are gone, Jack; let's dump the passengers now

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No way. He's ready for that

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: But howis he --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | don't know how. | just know he is. He's been a step ahead of me every time. If we unload he'l take them out, | guarantee ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit 85. (4)

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Where does that put us?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | got to try to dismantle that bomb.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: That's not an option.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What would you do if the bus was standing still?

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Jack, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: BUS
dialogues.text: near the back.

dialogues.speaker: ERRY
dialogues.text: So, what'd you do, man?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: ERRY
dialogues.text: Why'd you go apeshit before? What'd you do

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Nothing, man. Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: ERRY
dialogues.text: Come on! Was it a gang thing, what ?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Not hi ng! (after a moment) | stole the gun, man. You know. From my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: Ray looks sidelong at Terry. He's either being defensive or lying.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Home protection.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT
dialogues.text: Ortiz and Stephens are standing at the front with Annie.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: I'mtelling you, Annie, the guy's somewhere jerking off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: He didn't have to get on in the first place, Ortiz. And get your ass behind the yellowline. | have faith. (to herself) | have faith.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: What's that? They all look out at something pulling in front of them. Their eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Oh my good he is insane. ANGLE ON THEIR P.O. V. A truck has pulled in front of them Attached to is a low wooden dolly. Jack is standing on it in gear, with a headset and a bunch of tools.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: he back

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: t his SWAT McMahon is on the back of the truck. He has a headset as well.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: We're not gonna be able to keep this steady for long. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | just need a few minutes. If | can't do it by then | can't do it at all.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into headset) Harry. You with me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (0.s.) All the way.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Okay, this is it. Don't get dead. Barely a moment between them, and then Jack is lying down on the dolly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Watching the dolly inch closer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (slowly, as it sinks in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a really bad plan.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: Have faith, sister. Jack smiles at Annie, gives her the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Just keep it steady.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks for the tip. The truck slows a bit and the dolly inches closer to the bus. Jack lies completely flat as the bus approaches. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts to disappear under the bus. Annie squints with concentration. McMahon looks on, concerned. Jack | ooks straight up, keeping as calm as possible as the bus cover his head.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: Jack inches under the bomb. He speaks (always into the headset, until stated otherwise) to McMahon.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay, tell themto hold here. He looks up at the bomb. Fromhis P.0O.V. the bomb is so close it fills our line of vision. There are wires runnin fromthe timer to various detonators. Also a few covered wires of different colors sticking in one end of the time and out the other.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's pretty standard. Timer's looped to the remote, then feeds out.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then we gotta try to b remote current with th Can you find the trip remote? p e y. h r r the ypass t e batte wire fo

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | don't know. | got a few choices here.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Black and red?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And green. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Listen. I'm guessing he's not going to use standard copper for the remote. Too weak. I'd use a fiber alloy. | need you to look at the wire

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It's covered.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: | know. You gotta cut off the sheath. But don't cut the wire

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ri ght.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Start with the green. He has to work slowly. He's so close to the bus he can't look at his tools; he feels for them and brings them up t his chest He palms an exacto and carefully starts scraping away at the green plastic covering. The bus hits a tiny...

dialogues.speaker: BUMP
dialogues.text: and Jack SLIPS, goes stock still as sweat drips down his forehead. He looks at the knife. It has gone halfway through the wire. Very, very slowly, he pulls it out He scrapes some more at the sheath, revealing a silverish wire: not copper.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Bull seye.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Great. Clip on the battery and run it to the lead wire He palms the battery, clips one end to the silver wire wi the alligator clip. He searches out the lead wire. He finds it, a cloud crossing his expression. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | can't bypass. It'll fire.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Collapsible circuit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Shit! This thing is airtight. Harry is thinking when Robin enters, moves toward him wit a printout, speaking.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN
dialogues.text: Howard Fisk, Atlanta P.D., bomb squad, retired to Sun Valley in 1989 when a small charge left him with fingers numbering nine. And on that last word she reaches Harry, turning the printout for himto see and Fisk's picture stares us in th ace.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's out scumbag. (into walkie talkie) Jack, we found him!

dialogues.speaker: ROBI N
dialogues.text: We can get to his place inside of fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jack! Get out of there and sit tight! We're going after the source.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Watch your back. Harry jumps up and they move out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mac! Pull me out!

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: (0. s.) Roger that, kid. Hold on. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE TI RE
dialogues.text: That was scraped by the claw...a piece of outer rubber peels off and flies into the:

dialogues.speaker: DOLLY WHEEL
dialogues.text: which catches, stops.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: As the dolly is almost pulled out from under him.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE
dialogues.text: Is running past him now, skittling over the pavement, sparking, whipping around. And it's heading for a rear wheel. If the cable gets pulled under the tire...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Reaches for the cable, to pull it back. Too late.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABLE
dialogues.text: Hits the wheel and is sucked under in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND THE DOLLY
dialogues.text: Are snapped toward the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: God!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: Did we hit him? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: He's not behind us! Annie and Ortiz look at each other. They're dragging him. Ortiz RACES for the center panel, starts unscrewing it. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: MCMAHON' S Al RPORT VEHI CLE moves alongside the bus. McMahon tries to see what's happening to Jack. He looks pretty concerned.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: Jack tries to get a grip on the undercarriage, but his fingers can't find purchase. So he grabs the screwdriver and stabs it up into the undercarriage. It digs in. He stops, and the dolly is yanked out from under him.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOLLY
dialogues.text: Hits the rear wheel, is pulled under and destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: holds onto the screwdriver. Liquid sprays down on him. He coughs, reaches out, grabs a hydraulic line and pulls himself away fromthe spray. His shoes skid over pavement at 50 mp.h. Jack looks around, sees light coming fromthe hole in the floor, three feet away. He reaches for the hole. He can't make it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey! Ortiz sticks his head down.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Man, can you reach me? He reaches for Jack, but there's no way.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Hold my legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry and Ray grab Ortiz's legs. Stephens and Mrs. Kamino grab them.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: Ortiz is halfway through the hole. He reaches for Jack. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Come on! He grabs him. Jack lets go the screwdriver, grabs Ortiz's shoul der.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sl owl y, painfully, Jack is pulled in. He hunches over, pain.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Are you okay? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: Any luck with the bomb?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, it didn't go off. Ortiz dusts himoff. Oddly enough, he is smiling

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: You may be a psycho, man, but you got some big round balls.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That's very... gross, Ortiz. He goes over to Annie

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Can't even pay the guy a compl i ment

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: You scared the shit out of me, Jack. Other than that, I'm pretty lousy. What's that smell? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (realizing) It's gas.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We're leaking gas?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We are now.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: What, you needed a challenge?

dialogues.speaker: GAS GAUGE
dialogues.text: It starts dropping, barely perceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: on the back of the airport vehicle, is relieved when he sees Jack surface inside the bus. He gives a thunmbs-up sign to Jack and his vehicle falls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's car and another unmarked fire up the street with much attendant screeching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Annie nervously regard the gas gauge.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) Mac? Can you get a fuel truck to pace us here? We're losing gas.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: I'll see what | can find. How much time?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | don't know. Ten minutes. It's not good.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Is that gonna work? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | don't know. (to himself) Come on, Harry. Save my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and the others pull up quietly across the street. H and Robin emerge from his car, two other SWAT guys fromth second car. One is SWAT Cop#1. They go to the front of the house in standard formation. They stop at the windows by the garage. The venetian blinds are still down -- can' see in. Harry motions for two to go around the back. He takes Robin around the side. There is a door here. Robin is about to try the knob but Harry GRABS her hand, shakes his head. He motions for her to go around the back, which she does. He tries the window and it gives. It's clean, no wires. Harry goes in first. He climbs slowly, pulling his wounde leg in. He gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is in the living room, heading for the garage. WE SEE Robin come silently in through a back window, motion for the other two to wait outside. She and Harry both start converging on the garage, looking around them, guns raised. Harry looks down at his leg just as it trips an electric eye in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELECTRIC EYE
dialogues.text: is wired to something. A red light goes on. Harry and Robin look at each other, knowing it's the last thing they will ever see.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosion blasts out the windows, sending the other t flying, wounded. The last thing WE SEE are the venetian blinds as they are shredded when that windowis also blown out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S PHONE
dialogues.text: Ri ngs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Harry! Tell me good news, man. There is a pause. And Jack knows.

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack. He didn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: It was the watch that led himto me, wasn't it? It felt alittle hammy to me, building the bomb from my previous retirement gift. But | figured a sign that said ‘I'm Howard Fisk' would be pushing it. As he speaks, he opens the venetian blinds. We !ook out o Pershing Square: he was never in the house at all.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm gonna rip your fucking spine out, | swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: You'll do as you're told! Now Harry's gone. Just accept it. (more) ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: FISK (cont'd) Jack, we both know he was the brains of your particular operation. You're not gonna beat me. You're gonna pay me all of my dollars. Otherwise you, the wildcat and every innocent soul on that bus is gonna end up just like your friend. Now pay attention! Are you listening?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (softly) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: Good. Tell themthe drop point is Pershing Square. There's a garbage can on the northeast corner. Dump the bags and | eave. | don't show up until your people are gone and | don't disarm until I'mclear. Getting on toward 11:00, Jack. | think it's gonna be a pretty day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Jack SMASHES the phone against a pole, furious. Everybody stares at him He leans against the front window., seething.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Jack? He throws the remains of the phone to the floor, unable t respond.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, Jack, don't you fold on me now! He whips his head around, stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You just cool it, okay? We're scared. We need you. (more) ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: ANNIE (cont'd) | need you, with a clear head. | know this guy's hurting you and I'm sorry, but we still have a problem here so stop doing the asshole dance and be part of the solution. He still stares, but she's drawn the fire out. Everybody is staring at him. He smiles winningly at Annie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: We got this far. He falls silent again. His gaze goes from her face to her shirt, the Arizona tee shirt. For a moment he !ooks al mo puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHI RT
dialogues.text: Beneath the Arizona is a picture of a wildcat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. Jack kneels by her, daubing her brow, speaking softly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You go to University of Arizona?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good football team.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Arizona Wlidcats. They went nine straight wins last year. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (completely lost) Ri ght. Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He can see you. She starts to ask but he shushes her, standing and leanin again on the windshield. Slowly he looks around at the front of the bus. His P.O.V. searches for it, and there i is, behind the big convex mirror with a view of the whole bus. The thin wires, the red light. A camera. We pushin on it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pull out, looking at the camera's P.O.V. on a smal black and white screen next to Fisk's other TVs. We pull out further to see Fisk as his eyes flit from screen to screen, resting on the black and white image. On the screen, Jack kneels once again by Annie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He called you a wildcat before. | didn't even pick up on it. Bastard has a camera right in your face. He can see the whole bus. He's been playing me from minute one.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: He's looking at me? Can he hear me?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like. He's just wat ching.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: What do | do?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nothing. Act scared. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (plenty scared) What's my motivation? Jack strides to the back of the bus, talking into his throat mike.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mac, Mac...are you there?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: Jack, how much longer can we circle? He holds up a finger to shush her as McMahon gets on the line. EXT. Al RPORT McMahon arrives at the base camp

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Yeah, go ahead, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Mac, | know about Harry. Listen, there's no time. Is that news van still around?... Good. It's time for a little turnabout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMahon and a few other cops rush to the van.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: L.A.P.D. We need this shit. (to a crew guy) Can you broadcast on a UHF frequency?

dialogues.speaker: CREW GUY
dialogues.text: Sure. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Good. There's a signal coming fromthat bus. Find it. The crew guy starts turning dials. After some snow, the shot of the bus appears on one of his screens.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Good. Tape off this. The crew guy sticks in a tape, hits "record." An angry reporter steps in.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Hey, this is private property! You can't just take it!

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Yeah, why don't you call a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is sitting near the front. Everyone is sitting, looking tense.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (quietly, but to everyone) Remember, no big movements. Just look whipped.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: That's not gonna be too hard. And WE PAN along the bus, picking up everyone's face as they try to appear casually despondent. We pass Jack and Annie and close in on the fuel gauge -- is it picking up speed?

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: WE SEE as the screwdriver is jolted looser and looser, an the leak grows.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEWS VAN
dialogues.text: McMahon and the others watch the bus on screen.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie notices the fuel gauge as it drops below a quarter tank.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: (quietly) Jack...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Our leak has sprung a leak. We gotta get off. Slowly, Jack brings the walkie talkie to his face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: McMahon? Fuel ?

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Mrs. Kamino drops her purse, nervous. She doesn't know if she should pick it up. Sits nervously.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not enough time. Run the tape. We have to unload.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: We only got a minute of

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: (to the crew guy) Run it. Run it on a loop. He starts pressing buttons and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image plays on the TV. Sounds of Fisk FLUSHING inside A slight JUMP in the image just before Fisk sits down, watches. The tape is now playing.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks back and forth between his watch and the gas gauge.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Come on. Then he looks over and sees... AN Al RPORT TRUCK Pulls alongside the bus. McMahon and SWAT cops...

dialogues.speaker: THE LEFT REAR WHEEL OF THE BUS
dialogues.text: The outside wheel. More rubber is peeling off: it's gonna pop any second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack strides to the back doors.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Okay, Annie. Annie flips a switch. The back emergency door opens. McMahon tosses a length of 2-by-4 and some rope to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Rig the gas pedal and steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Got cha.

dialogues.speaker: FISK'S TV
dialogues.text: The taped image of the inside of the bus. Quiet and calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intense activity as the passengers line up to get off.

dialogues.speaker: THE LEFT REAR TI RE
dialogues.text: Rubber is peeling off, flapping on the pavement.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stands on the back steps. The first passenger to get off is Mrs. Kamino. Jack ushers her off into the arms of Norwood. Annie is steering and trying to tie off the whee

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Next! Let's go! Annie, how're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: I''m doing!

dialogues.speaker: BUS AND TRUCK
dialogues.text: More women get off the buss, followed by Terry and Ortiz.

dialogues.speaker: HE LEFT REAR TI RE
dialogues.text: Big strips are peeling off. Seconds froma blowout.

dialogues.speaker: NSERT
dialogues.text: Shows the bus as calm, quiet.

dialogues.speaker: NT. THE BUS
dialogues.text: Jack helps Terry off. Stephens is about to step across...

dialogues.speaker: HE LEFT REAR TI RE
dialogues.text: he tread peels off completely.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Gasps as the steering wheel spins, wrenched from her grip

dialogues.speaker: HE BUS
dialogues.text: Swerves hard away fromthe truck.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS
dialogues.text: nthe stairwell, doesn't know what to do. Panics and jumps for the truck.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Stephens! Jack grabs for him, misses. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUS AND TRUCK
dialogues.text: Stephens’ upper body reaches the truck. He swings under, is slipping.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: is the closest to him He grabs for Stephens' hand, gets it.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS' FEET
dialogues.text: Are skidding on the pavement, dangerously close to the re wheels.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHENS AND ORTIZ
dialogues.text: A look between them. Stephens grins with relief.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Okay, man, pull! They just pull himup in time. They smile at their victory all except Stephens himself, who looks like he has vomit his mind.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Annie fights to regain control of the steering.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Veers toward the airline terminals.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Annie and Jack look ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Jack. THEIR P.O. V. The terminals.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: is able to steer back onto the runway. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: The passengers watch in horror as the bus angles off.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KAMI NO
dialogues.text: Please, God, no.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Come on, man, you can doit...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wedge down the pedal! Hurry! Jack goes back and picks up the 3x5 floor panel he took o of the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Tears along the runway...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Jack maneuvers the floor panel down onto the hole, lettin it out on a length of rope. The other end of the rope is tied to a seat support.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: The edge of the panel touches the speeding pavement, bounces and splinters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie finishes tying off the steering wheel and wedging down the gas pedal.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Done. They hear an eerie choking sound. Then silence. Out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: SPEEDOMETER
dialogues.text: Is dropping. 58... 57... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Go! Annie gets out of the driver's seat, hurries to Jack. He helps her down into the hole

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: Is headed for a small jet whose engines have been strippe for repair.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: The wood panel is skidding over the pavement, sparks are flying off. Annie gets down onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope and 2x4 are holding. Jack takes one last | ook ahead. HIS P.O. V. The wing of the small jet comes SMASHING through the windshield and rips through one side of the bus, coming right at us, nearly decapitating Jack and he jumps down through the hole

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BUS
dialogues.text: and crouches on the sled, he and Annie holding onto each other and...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: ...dack and Annie blast out from underneath the bus in a shower of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope starts to loosen on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts to veer off toward an airplane hangar and... Jack and Annie slide to a stop against a large blinking runway sign. They look up. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: he bus toward the huge open door of the Al RPLANE HANGAR and disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: NT. HANGAR
dialogues.text: he bus rolls under the wings of a parked 747, between other jumbos and...careens out the other side of the hang

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY DC10 CARGO PLANE
dialogues.text: s towed along the runway by a towtruck...

dialogues.speaker: NSERT
dialogues.text: Plunges to 50.

dialogues.speaker: HE BOMB
dialogues.text: he red light goes out. he bus EXPLODES... ...while still rolling at a healthy 49 miles an hour. Whatever part of it can still roll PLOWS into the DC10... which explodes... A huge fireball and a shower of metal..

dialogues.speaker: ACK AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: heads as debris rains down. He is on top of Cover their It finally stops. her. Annie looks at the flaming carcass. Jack looks at Annie. After a moment, she looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Yes. Another moment. He still hasn't gotten off her. The moment between themis intimate, Annie is about to burst into tears.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You're not gonna say something mushy, are you? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What? No. He gets off her and they stand. For a moment she falls against him, but she rights herself. They head for the ambul ance.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Relationships based on intense experiences never last. I've read extensively on this.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You thought that was intense? | do this everyday. (after a moment) | think | broke my spleen.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: as it races up to Jack and Annie. Medics pop out, start patching them up. Annie is still talking to Jack. McMahon comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: How're you doing? Jack and Annie look at each other, almost laughing. They look back at Mac as if to say, "Eh."

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Well maybe I'll let you have the rest of the day off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Oh. Mac, this is Annie. Annie, Capt ain McMahon.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's a slight awkward moment -- feels like introducing yo girlfriend to your dad. Norwood runs up to Mac with a phone.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: It's him. He wants to know when he's gonna get his money.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: (grabbing the phone) That son of a bitch, I'll t what he can do with -- ell him Realization blooms in Jack's face. He puts his hand over Mac's.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He doesn't know it blew up. McMahon pauses, stonefaced. He brings the phone to his ea

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops finalize their preparations. UNDERCOVER COPS mov here and there, signal to each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Snipers take position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance pulls up, no lights or sirens. Jack gets out. Other undercover police cars are nearby and cops rus quietly to and fro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMahon is setting up his command post in a barbershop.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is just finished being patched up. She steps out of the ambulance to watch Jack's receding figure, her face etched with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He |ooks down on Pershing Square. HIS P.O. V. On the street, a garbage truck pulls up next to the can o the northwest corner. A cop dressed as a garbageman gets out, deposits two bags in the garbage, and drives on. Fisk looks more carefully around the square. Again from his P.O. V., WE CAN SEE: A cop running behind a doorway a block away. A sniper crouching low on a roof. Fisk smiles, heads for the door. He stops at the TV that shows Jack and the others on the still circling bus.

dialogues.speaker: FI SK
dialogues.text: It's too bad, Jack. You probably would have made a good cop. On the screen, Mrs. Kamino drops her purse. There is a glitch. The purse is in her hands. Fisk stares at the TV, eyes wide. A screamrises in his throat but before it comes out we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, McMahon and Norwood look out froma storefront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie is standing by the ambulance, still looking in Jack general direction. Cops run to and fro, some keeping pedestrians back. A SWAT cop comes up to Annie. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: CoP Miss, we can't have you this close, we need you to move back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: But Jack -- CoP Officer Traven asked for you to be brought out of harm's way. Let's just move back. Relenting, she turns to the cop. It's Howard Fisk. She smiles as he leads her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The can stands alone on the northeast corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is becoming increasingly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: He's running a little late. Jack looks at his watch. 11:02.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He's not late.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He's never late.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: That money hasn't moved. We've got two hundred eyes on that can. We've got a homing beacon in the bags. He's covered.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Turn it on.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: What for? He's not ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Do it! Norwood does, |ooks down.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOMING DEVICE
dialogues.text: The bags are moving.

dialogues.speaker: NORWOOD
dialogues.text: Shit... Jack bolts for the can.

dialogues.speaker: MCMAHON
dialogues.text: Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack DASHES across the street. He runs to the garbage cans, pushes them over. Below where the garbage can stood, there's a jagged hole in the concrete, opening up into a utility access tunnel

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hang-drops down into the tunnel. He hears the sound of hurrying footsteps down the tunnel. Jack pulls the gun from his waistband and takes off after the sound. FARTHER DOW THE TUNNEL. . ... SOMEONE runs, holding the bags of money. Jack pulls o his Glock, draws a bead...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: FREEZE! Turn around The person stops ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Pop quiz, asshole. | got a hair trigger aimed at your brain and |I'minareally shitty mood. What do you do? The person turns, face coming into the light. It's...

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: And she is very scared.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Incredul ous.
