dialogues.text: opens up the jacket she's wearing to reveal TEN POUNDS OF C-4 strapped to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Christ. An EMERGENCY DOOR on the side of the tunnel opens.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Steps out, holding a deadman stick.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Be prepared. That's the boy scouts marching song.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: What do you do, Jack. Can't shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: | don't think I'm gonna do that. He has a bag, which he drops at Annie's feet. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Fill it. (to Jack) | think Harry would be disappointed, finding us right back where we started.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let her go! You got the money! Take it and walk! You don't need her!

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: You still don't understand, Jack. The beauty of it. A bomb is made to explode; that's its meaning, its purpose. Your life is empty because you spend it trying to stop the bomb from becoming. And for what? For who? You know what a bomb is, Jack, that doesn't explode? It's a cheap gold watch.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're crazy. Annie finishes filling the bag. Fisk takes it.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Poor people are crazy, Jack. (hoisting the bag of money) I'm eccentric.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (one last time) Let her go! Fisk looks at Jack, almost fondly. Then he bolts through a door with Annie, slamming it shut behind him. Jack runs up to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack tries the door. It's locked. he aims his gun and blows the door handle to pieces. He tugs the door open an light floods in ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: Jack steps through the door and is very surprised to find himself in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the upper level. Not many people around. Someone runs up the stairs, looking frightened. jack down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are shying away from Fisk and Annie as they make their way along the platform. He has his gun out and she' wearing bombs. People start getting off the subway, heading for the stairs. Fisk pulls Annie onto the first car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three people, sitting. Smiles at one of them.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Is this seat taken? Everyone clears off. All the cars are empty now as the doors close and the train starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack runs down the stairs, yelling. Sprints along the platform as the train starts pulling out of the station. He jumps, just grabs the end of the fourth car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk handcuffs Annie to a vertical handpole. He hands her the deadman stick.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: You don't want to drop this. I'm counting on you. He moves to the front of the car as the driver starts out of the compartment.

dialogues.speaker: DRI VER
dialogues.text: What the hell is going -- ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: Fisk SHOOTS four times at point blank, sends him flying back into the compartment. Two of the shots blast the control panel. Annie cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouching, Jack is making his way to the first car, leavi the connecting doors open as he goes. He peers into the first car as Fisk finishes shooting, just in time to see him retrieve the deadman's stick.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Smiles at Annie as he takes it.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Maybe | better hold this after all. I'm afraid you're a little hysterical and might let go a mite early. It's not ‘cause you're a woman. He heads for the back and almost sees Jack. Wth nowhere to go, Jack climbs on the top of the car. Fisk looks out at the other cars.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Looks like we're all alone. Nobody wanted this train.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: You can let me go. You won, you beat Jack, you beat everyone. Throw me off the train, | don't care. Only let me go. He speaks to her softly.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: This stick works on a remote. See, when you explode, that's where they'll come. But it's not where I'll be. Mess like that, they don't even count the body parts. Gives me time. He brushes hair from her face. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: It's not gonna hurt, Annie

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF TRAIN
dialogues.text: Pipes and concrete ceiling whips by Jack's head. He check his gun and a red conduit pipe RIPS it from his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisk and Annie HEAR the gun bouncing off the top of the ttle wil i t car. Fisk looks up, smiles a li diy.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Is that you, Jack? (to Annie) He's persistent. He always gets his man. He grabs the bag of money, opens it. Looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: Don't suppose you'd be interested in a bribe, would you? (chuckl es) Got plenty to go around... Inside the bag, a dye pack explodes. Fisk looks down at his now useless money, some of the dye dripping like blue shadows on his face. He SCREAMS Still roaring, Fisk whips out his gun and pumps a round into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Fisk's bullets come up all around Jack, the last one ripping into his arm. He clutches it, in agony

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Fisk keeps firing unti then, it's hard for him he gun clicks repeatedly. Even 0 stop. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: No more shots -- Fisk must be out of bullets. Jack starts inching for the back of the car. Fisk is right behind him. Unchecked fury mars his face more than the eeri e semblance of control is gone. Roaring, he SLAMS into Jack's face. dye. All his fist He practically foaming at the mouth, hitting Jack with th hand that holds the deadman's stick. Jack is helpless; he's wounded and Fisk has the stick. He feebly tries to defend himself. Fisk is on his knees over Jack. He starts hitting Jack in his arm wound. Jack nearly blacks out from pain.

dialogues.speaker: FISK
dialogues.text: What do you do, Jack? What do you do? You're so smart! Right, Jack? You little piece of shit! | got the plan! I|'msmarter than you! I'm smarter than you! JACK'S P.O. V. Blurred, shifting. There is light on the ceiling. They're tearing through another station. Jack suddenly pulls back his leg and SLAMS it into Fisk's solar plexus. Fisk flies back, standing straight up on hi knees and:

dialogues.speaker: A RED CONDUIT PI PE
dialogues.text: meets his face.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHI NG ROUND
dialogues.text: Bounces along the top of the train like a tin can discard along a freeway... FISK' § HAND clenched in a literal death grip over the stick...it star to loosen... ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...and Jack GRABS the hand at the last second, closing it taking the stick before Fisk's body even hits the top of the train. Jack holds the stick, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'mtaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie turns warily at the sound of a door sliding open. Relief. It's Jack.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Fisk? By way of reply, he holds the deadman's stick up, al most smiling. Annie looks very relieved.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | ripped his head off. He takes off her vest and defuses the C-4 and neutralizes the deadman stick. Goes to the driver's compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks. The equipment was shot to shit. Jack sees the braking controls, flips the switches. Nothing. Grabs the speed dial/lever and tries to pull it back toward the lef but it won't budge. It's jammed up. Pushes it forward -- the train goes FASTER. Tries the radio mike -- DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: RUNS back into the passenger compartment.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C'mon, we gotta jump. She shows him her handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: You can't stop it? ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTI NUED
dialogues.text: He pulls at the hand cuffs, pulls at her wrists, tries to unscrew the pole with a knife -- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: barrels down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Goes apeshit. He kicks the pole, screaming with effort. Again. Again. Pulls at it. Pulls at her till her wrists bleed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Nooooo000W He stops. Her eyes are wet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Jack, you have to get off. No way. He looks up at the map. There's a big curve, then dead end.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Jack, listen to me...the end of this line is solid rock. You have to jump. Goddamnit, I'm ordering you! Go! He |ooks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Faster.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: Jack... Going to the driver's compartment.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The only way to stop this thing is to make it go faster. There's a curve up ahead. We go fast enough we might jump the track, hit something besides a dead end.  122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns the knob hard right, comes back out...

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: This is bullshit, Jack. You have to get off this train, Jack! Jack! He says nothing. Comes up to the pole she's at, holds on. Braces himself. She falls silent as well. Drops her cuffs around him. Holds himtight. They wait. The train ROARS along the track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still under construction. At the end of the station the track dead-ends into a ROCKFACE.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: brace themselves...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C'mon...Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barreling through the station... it's going way too fast, but it's holding the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jarred by the rough ride. The lights flicker on and off. Smoke from overheated engines rises into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The construction crews are fleeing. A truck speeds off up the ramp, hauling dirt out.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Hits the curve. The train wheels SPARK on the rails, SCREECH.

dialogues.speaker: JACK AND ANNIE
dialogues.text: Eyes shut, holding tight. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Wth Jack and Annie skids sideways up the ramp... Steel SHEARS the car in half... The front half continues to ski and roll up the ramp and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...appears. Above ground, like a breaching whale, skiddin and crashing and finally resting on its side in front of the Chinese Theater, to the amazement of dazzled onlooker Jack and Annie visible through the now-open back of the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Annie sit up, find they are all right. The pole has been wrenched fromthe ceiling and Jack pulls Annie's hands free. They suddenly kiss, desperately alive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNI E
dialogues.text: You didn't leave me... (looks himin the eye) You didn't leave. (holds him again) My God...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: | didn't have to be anywhere just then.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: How boring?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: How boring are you? | mean, is it really scary?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (thinks a moment) | watch bowling on TV.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Okay. ( CONTI NUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Sometimes when | watch bowling, | get excited and | cheer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Ooh. Well...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Annie, it's over. You can walk away. She takes his hand, quickly and gentle clicks the other cuff on him, joining them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Ma'am... And they sit awhile.

dialogues.speaker: TOURISTS WTH CAMERAS
dialogues.text: arrive on the scene. Train their cameras on the kissing pair. FADE OUT.
